00014 #ifndef VMI_CACHE_H
00015 #define VMI_CACHE_H
00016 
00017 // VMI header files
00018 #include "vmi/vmiCacheAttrs.h"
00019 #include "vmi/vmiTypes.h"
00020 
00021 //
00022 // Value to use for an uninitialized cacheContext value
00023 //
00024 #define INVALID_CACHE_CONTEXT ((void *)~0)
00025 
00026 //
00027 // Return a description string for a vmiCacheType
00028 //
00029 static inline const char *vmiCacheTypeName(vmiCacheType type) {
00030     switch (type) {
00031     case VMI_CT_I: return "ICache";
00032     case VMI_CT_D: return "DCache";
00033     default:       return "???";
00034     }
00035 }
00036 
00037 //
00038 // Called to enable/disable a cache and register/clear callbacks for cache events
00039 //
00040 // When enable is true the cache is enabled, when false it is disabled
00041 //
00042 // CB functions may be specified as NULL if no callback is required.
00043 //
00044 // Returns a unique name for the cache if successful, If the same cache
00045 // is connected to multiple processors they will each get the same name returned.
00046 // NULL if no cache with that type is available
00047 //
00048 // userData will be passed to callback functions
00049 //
00050 // To get callbacks on all cache events this must be called for every
00051 // processor connected to the cache when the cache is shared between
00052 // multiple processors (e.g. in a multi-threaded processor)
00053 //
00054 const char *vmirtCacheRegister( \
00055     vmiProcessorP        processor,
00056     vmiCacheType         cacheType,
00057     Bool                 enable,
00058     vmiCacheHitFn        hitCB,
00059     vmiCacheMissFn       missCB,
00060     vmiCacheInvalidateFn invalidateCB,
00061     void                *userData
00062 );
00063 
00064 #endif /* VMI_CACHE_H */
